meanings.definition: Confessed to be true or to be the case.
meanings.sent1: The admitted fact was that the sky is blue.
meanings.sent2: It is widely admitted that honesty is important.
meanings.sent3: The admitted truth about cats is that they love to nap.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an admitted sign of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The admitted reality of the situation was hard to ignore.

meanings.definition: Allowed to enter a place or become a member of a group.
meanings.sent1: Only admitted students were allowed in the library after hours.
meanings.sent2: The admitted guests enjoyed the party.
meanings.sent3: The admitted visitors were greeted with warm smiles.
meanings.sent4: Being an admitted member of the team brought great joy.
meanings.sent5: The admitted attendees had exclusive access to the event.

meanings.sent1: The admitted proposal was well-received by the committee.
meanings.sent2: Her admitted mistake was forgiven by her friends.
meanings.sent3: The admitted excuse for being late was quite creative.
meanings.sent4: His admitted talent for painting was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The admitted solution to the problem was surprisingly simple.
